intro: Leleba rumphiana, commonly known as the white leleba, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
